bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, June 5, 1919

div1.p: Blue sends Carter to Atlantic City, New Jersey to present a paper at a yellow fever symposium.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, June 5, 1919
div1.opener:
E.E.M.
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U.S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
June 5, 1919.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:
div1.p:
You are hereby directed to proceed to Atlantic
City, N. J., for the purpose of presenting a paper at the
symposium on yellow fever before the Tropical Society
which meets with the Congress of American Physicians
and Surgeons, June 16th and 17th, 1919. Upon the com-
pletion of this detail you will rejoin your station at
Baltimore, Maryland.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon General. SP
Jns
The expenses incurred in carrying out the fore-
going instructions are hereby authorized.
JS Moyle
Assistant Secretary.
R.Q
✓
